    Now it is possible to store any curve with the Save Selected Curve as... option. Read the remarks to avoid unwanted results.
    Fallback for edge detection with missing penumbra's and wedged profiles by using profile matching. 

    version 2.07 25/01/2012
    Some wedged fields were not analysed correctly. A histogram is used to find a central band of points to ignore in the derived function when looking for the minimum. With very high peak maximum values almost all points were collected in one single bin with default bin size, which would lead to a missing minimum. Now the number of bins is doubled until less then 25% of the points is in a single bin. The exact minimum and maximum in the derivative are now calculated using a quadratic fit.
    The help file has been expanded with a Profile analysis strategy section which gives an overview of the behavior of the program.

    version 2.06 12/08/2011
    Minor issue with "RefDir" item in the configuration file. When the program is installed on a network drive and the drive mapping is not identical on different clients, Thus a fully qualified path for the reference directory might not exist. Bistromath forced then a Windows system error message and failed to find the reference directory. When the drive does not exist, this version will fall back on default settings. Eventually this directory will be created.

    version 2.05 16/05/2011
    Extended file naming possibillities. The detector type and field size in mm can be used now.

    version 2.04 08/05/2011
    Further improved stategy for missing penumbras: now a center position is calculated if there are clearly defined peaks in the derivative. This is used to align the reference with the measurement. This can be switched off now.
    The color scheme of the results panel is revised. Values based on estimations are red.

    version 2.03 29/04/2011
    Improved stategy for missing penumbras. No shift is done before comparing the profiles.

    version 2.02 22/04/2011
    Implementation of Resample option.

    version 2.01 10/03/2011
    Two versions of this help file are introduced to support also Vista/Windows 7.
    Minor bugs: 
    - The depth values were inverted for exported files in Scanditronix (wtx/wda) format.
    - For iterative file conversion a negative number of failures was reported when there were actually none.
    - Incorrect named reference files could be used, without being dismissed completely.
    - The actual value of the normalisation on Field Center item was passed but not used the first time after program startup.
    Refinements:
    - Unzoom sets the maximum of the vertical scale to 103% of the found data maximum.
    - The In-Field field indicators are extended to 103% of the data maximum and the minimum of the curves at the indicators.
    - The selftest is extended with wedged profiles.
    - A separator symbol, "_", is introduced in the conversion tab file naming facilities.
    - The Editor cannot be closed anymore through its menu. It would become invisible but stay functional.
    - The selftest disables all menu items temporarily.

    version 2.00 11/02/2011
    This version contains a selftest.
    Several small bugs were repaired. These bugs only showed on theoretical profiles with vertical slopes and/or very few points.
    The View / Zoom function now also works for depth dose curves when there is a reference and the calculated curve is the division of measurement and reference.
    When a new reference file is saved, the file is reread from the editor window, which automatically loads the new reference.
    The depth dose files as produced by XiO have inverted depth values and thus do not follow the conventions. Therefore this was corrected without any further checks. When produced from Monaco data the depth dose data followed the normal conventions. Both variants aro no supported.
    Multiple configuration sets for one modality might lead to inconsistent results. This is handled now correctly.


    See also:
     Configuration
     Recent History
     History v1.00 - v1.99
     History v2.70 - v2.98


    History v2.70 - v2.98
    general information 

    version 2.98, build 513, 26/07/2016
    The introduction of FFF beams introduces new phenomena when changing beam parameters. In the discussions at my clinic this led to the conclusion that analysis based on the origin as beam center could be helpful. In the design of BistroMath the center was always defined as the avarage of left and right penumbra. 
  • In a new help topic all issues related to beam center and normalisation are presented. 
  • A new Center of field submenu in the Measurement menu offers three choices (penumbra, origin, maximum) for the beam center definition. The separate menu option Maximum is Center of Field therefore is removed.
  • The ordering of items in the Measurement menu is slightly changed for clarity.
  • Some <Shift+Alt> shortcut keys in the Measurement menu were changed to accomodate the new Center of field submenu.
  • Shifting to the origin is now based on the filtered version of the measurement, because that is also the base for presenting analysis results.
  • For FFF profiles the Top model curve is now plotted in a much higher resolution then the measurement step size.

    version 2.97, build 509, 07/07/2016
  • Minor bugfix: the Normalisation submenu did not respond.
  • A new FFF center submenu offers alternative methods to calculate the center of the field. New annotations have been assigned to the 'Center' value. After some discussion the slope area and central area are made configurable in the Settings tab.
  • A language thing: -ize words (except size) are replaced by -ise.

    version 2.96, build 506, 28/06/2016
    As general management feature to maintain a reliable setup now configuration file overloading is described in this help file. This has been designed as such from the very start of BistroMath. It comes to help with applying different tasks on top of a standard setup.
  • The limit for acceptable penumbra's is made accessible in the Advanced settings tab. The default is set to accept all penumbra's. The help file on this topic is clarified.
  • Changing tabs now clears the reference buffer to force a reload, except when it is a temporary reference.
  • The symmetry correction factor now clips when the profile falls below a certain fraction of the normalisation value.
  • In the Fit Results tab dmax is added. This value is not part of the model but used to rescale the model such that it produces 100 at dmax. The fit results are put on the clipboard immediately after the calculation, using the last known options and selection. 
    Review of the SpecialMode-functionality:
  • As addition to previous possibilities now any SpecialMode can be activated from the Processing menu. That state also can be saved to a configuration file.
  • SpecialMode2 is extended with reporting of the edge value, inflection point, user level position, symmetry, flatness, linac error, maximum, normalisation, division and gamma.
  • SpecialMode2 now also can be used for multiscan files.

    version 2.95, build 496, 04/06/2016
  • Bug report by user for reading MCC files: the values for SCAN_OFFAXIS_INPLANE and SCAN_OFFAXIS_CROSSPLANE were mixed up on conversion to the internal data format. A crossplane offset would shift the inplane scan positions.
  • Bug repair for the implementation of (switching off) axis preservation for exporting files of the Omnipro_v6 type in version 2.93. Actually this coding error failed to preserve the axis. Note that this bug also affects reference files written with version 2.93 and 2.94 when the T-direction is set to be negative. All other file types were implemented correctly.
  • The help file now contains a Quick Start guide. Work in progress. Comments welcomed.

    version 2.94, build 495, 23/05/2016
  • Bug report by user for reading and writing MCC files: new found values for the REF_SCAN_POSITIONS list were added to the already available values. Therefore this list would grow indefinitely. Because this list is not actively used in BistroMath but just stored for convenience when when writing MCC data, the same list would also grow in the written files. The effects, beside an increasing file length, for PTW software are unknown, but probably minor.

    version 2.93, build 494, 12/05/2016
  • Minor bug: when a generic data set representing a profile is forced to be used as pdd and the pdd fit is active and the mub_power is optimised, invalid fit data could lead to an unmanaged code failure.
  • Minor bug: the in-memory version of the reference was not not inverted when for the current measurement the axis setup was changed. Now the in-memory version is made invalid, forcing a reload of the reference.
  • Minor bug: after a code revision the linac name was not exported when writing Scanditronix files.
  • More explicit error messaging for wrong references. When the contents of a reference file are conflicting with its file name the reference is not used. This might be the case for inconsistent multi scan file references when the first scan header information is inconsistent with subsequent scan headers. Now, to surprise of the user, BistroMath will rightfully reject the reference for the second scan.
  • During the design of Bistromath a lot of effort was put in preserving data integrity on export. Therefore any axis swapping, which works on original data, was always compensated at export. However the user might choose to apply the axis swapping also to the exported data. Note that this may affect insitute wide data integrity when these data are mixed with original data.

    version 2.92, build 492, 14/04/2016
  • Minor bug fix: the Measurement option Generic to PDD did not work due to a code review before version 2.60. Not reported by any user.

    version 2.91, build 491, 31/03/2016
  • Patch for inconsistent output behavior of OmniPro v7.4 when the data in the "Normalised field" and "Current field" equal zero after making the data symmetric in OmniPro (message: "Maximum equals minimum").
  • Improved differentiation between true diagonal scans and "free scans". Diagonal scans should pass the origin and therefore the true field size can be evaluated from these scans. In previous versions the nearest measurement point should be within 0.5 cm of the origin. For the diagonals of the StarCheck Maxi the innermost points are at 1.43 cm. Now the distance between the scan line and the origin is evaluated.
  • Introduction of the Processing option Ignore name of Treatment Unit. By definition this option only works for temporary references. It is intended to compare identical beams of different linacs. The Aliases tab offers a more generalised approach which also will select references of a different linac.
  • In the Aliases tab now a message on available keys is displayed.
  • In the Files tab only files with a registered file extension are read, all other are ignored to avoid problems with strange formatted files. For .wda files the file name was not passed with the data, which only showed up as a problem in the Files tab. In multithreaded mode a message on completion is shown.

    version 2.90, build 486, 08/03/2016
  • Bug fix: The Measurement option Maximum is Center of Field was effectively ignored when activated. Now this calculation is executed elsewhere in the code.

    version 2.89, build 485, 29/02/2016
    Only changes to SpecialMode3:
  • Works now also for multiple-scan files.
  • The default output format can now be set at startup. Note that the last used output format is actually used.
  • Now the output can be either the original measurement or the filtered version of these data.

    version 2.88, build 484, 15/02/2016
    Display issues in the results panel solved:
  • The measurement date/time was accidently added to the d50 and d80 label for electron pdd's.
  • Any shift, preconfigured or manually applied, leads to an annotation for relevant labels.
  • When both absolute and relative flatness are given for a FFF-curve, the absolute flatness is followed by a "c". This actually stands for "%/cm".
    In some circumstances a message "Cannot focus on a disabled or invisible window" was displayed during startup. In the test situation this could only be forced by starting the application from a networked drive. The order of creation of both visible and invisible structures was carefully reviewed.
    For reading data from file, drag-and-drop and clipboard, the data are actually read to a stream and processed from that stream. The Editor is now filled after analysis from the same stream. Loading the editor is very time consuming for large files and can now be readily interrupted to load any other data.

    version 2.87, build 477, 02/02/2016
  • Minor bug: The state of the Detect FFF item in the Measurement menu could not be changed and was "on" after install. Not reported by anyone as a problem, but resolved now.
  • Logics of Setting/Unsetting a temporary reference have been changed from the old combination <Ctrl+T> as toggle function "set on/off" and <Ctrl+Shift+T> as "redefine" to the new combination <Ctrl+T> "set temporary reference" and <Ctrl+Shift+T> as "unset temporary reference".

    version 2.86, build 476, 12/01/2016
    While testing on other data the pdd model for photons showed to lead to a oscillating result. Despite recent code reviews the implementation of the Nelder-Mead optimisation worked flawless. It was the model itself that became unstable. This oscillation, induced by the buildup term, is now effectively dampened by introducing a buildup power factor in the photon model. The improvement is quit spectacular.
    After initial failing attempts to optimise also the buildup power factor now only the deviation from 1 (effectively no power factor) is included in the Nelder-Mead optimisation. When this still leads to unstable results the power factor can set fixed to any value between 1 and 2.  Also the Error to Noise Ratio is now added to the cost function. Both measures improve the outcome fully automatically in most cases. Alternatively some manual steering can be done.

    version 2.85, build 473, 04/01/2016
  • Testing on a predefined error value when this was set by the defined cost function attached to the Nelder-Mead module proved to be unreliable when comparing extreme values of floating point variables. This mechanism is needed to detect illegal combinations of parameters delivered to the cost function. With hindsight failing equality tests induced numerous extra runs of the procedure. In version 2.84 this was repaired by testing on reaching more then 90% of the extreme value. A small typing error was made in this process, leading to a suboptimal pdd fit. This is repaired here.
  • The space bar is used for quick selection of a graphical element (line or curve).
  • Resolved a graphical issue introduced in version 2.80. On changing the normalisation, the reference curve was updated only after reload of the same profile or loading another measurement.
  • For the linac symmetry error the sign of the error can now be set independently for GT and AB scans. For any other type of scan the sign is kept unchanged. The installation script will rename the item BeamRadiusSign to BeamRadiusSignGT in the configuration files. In institute.ini the item BeamRadiusSignAB is added.

    version 2.84, build 469, 20/12/2015
  • Spectacular processing speed improvement for large text-based data (files). This could take up to 5 seconds for a file of 1 MB and, with hindsight, was also noticable for small files. The bottleneck showed to be the transfer from the (rich text) editor to the (unformatted) text parsing module which is slow when the underlying data types are different. Now this transfer is done through an intermediate memory stream instead of direct copying.
  • Detection of FFF-profiles. Note that FFF-profiles have an alternative approach for analysis. This is denoted with a "F" for the flatness result. The absolute flatness is presented in percent/cm. The relative flatness remains unchanged and is still presented in percent.
  • The settings tab has slighty reorganised. A more fundamental approach to manage numerous parameters is prepared.
  • In the w2CAD format the original date string is now stored and copied to the appropriate field on import. Note that the comments field is used to transfer the linac name.
  • For recognised 2D-arrays the device name is taken as detector name.
  • Bug repair for recognised 2D-array data used as temporary reference. The current scan direction was used in all cases as reference. This bug was introduced in version 2.80 when the whole data input logistics were reviewed and temporary reference curves were kept in memory, thus avoiding storage to disk. Now not only the current scan is saved to memory but the complete file. From there the correct scan is loaded as needed. As added bonus still the correct scan direction is taken when the temporary file type check is switched off. Thus different linacs/beams might be compared.
  • The measurement menu has been reorganised and regrouped.
  • All lines in the graph area can be selected. When selected, the element is put to the foreground and the line width can be changed with the "{" and "}" key.

    version 2.83, build 462, 03/12/2015
  • Introduction of an additional sigmoid model based edge detection. This might improve sparse data sets. The related parameters are added to the Advanced settings tab.

    version 2.82, build 460, 23/10/2015
  • Minor bugfix: In SpecialMode2 file naming failed.
  • Support for multiple scan files in the (mass) file conversion tab.

    version 2.81, build 459, 05/10/2015
  • Bugfix: Due to a code reorganisation a temporary reference would not be shown or used in non standard installations. This is repaired.
  • Bugfix for OmniPro v7 data: when the maximum in ratio is low and a (therefore) a zero value was encountered, an inconsistent switch to another data column was made. Now the "Normalised Field" column is used in all these case. Note that the Normalised Field column is not corrected for the reference channel variations.
  • Tiny patch: quadratic filtering is applied after addition of two profiles. In a large code review for version 2.80 the data points from both profiles to be added were gathered using a the same routine that is used to evaluate the normalisation point. This makes the influence of both data sources on the result identical. However, the small calculation range used there may pass too much of the original noise. Therefore post-filtering is switched on again.

    version 2.80, build 456, 22/09/2015

    Introduction
    There have been numereous subversions, most of them in alpha state test mode. Some small issues have been solved afterwards. This build will be the final release of version 2.80.
    During testing in the production environment a new issue was found. One of the underlying problems showed to be the installation script which created the  institute.ini file in the (Windows7) path C:\ProgramData\. instead of the intended path C:\ProgramData\Bistromath where the application searches for it. All users are advised to run the install with this version. See also the topics on configuration and Installation issues.

    Overview
     New: For the MR-linac a dedicated water phantom with two detector positions is developed. The acquired data have a partial overlap. A full profile or depth dose curve has to be calculated from the combined signals. Matching is optionally used to stitch two partial profiles. To work succesfully with partial FFF-beams a number of revisions was needed.
     New: Mayneord correction for photon depth dose curves.
     New: Full support for the Sun Nuclear IC Profiler export format. This format can be exported from the Sun Nuclear software to file or clipboard. The latter provides a full link with BistroMath including dedicated reference files.
     New: Comparison of a profile with a mirrored copy and Maximum as center of field option as tools for FFF evaluation.
     New: Evaluation of position and level of maximum in depth dose curve based on a quadratic fit on top. This might give slight difference with previous versions.
    Improvements on the results panel including the composite attribute for curves.
    Improvements in matching for FFF and missing penumbra situations.
    Improvements and bug fixes for the PTW (Mephysto) .mcc format.
    Minor bug fixes.

    Details
  • Revision of the edge detection function. One missing penumbra would invalidate the calculated center of field and both edge positions. Now any succesfully found edge will be valid. Extra measures to exclude false edges are taken. See the detailed explanation at the Edge fallback topic.
  • Revision of match-function to handle also (FFF) beams with one missing penumbra. The matching area is now limited to provide roughly the same profile values at both sides of the area. An initial calculated optimal shift is used to set a starting value for the cost function. The revised edge detection was needed here to initialise the process on a single edge. The match cost function is now normalised on the number of succesfully matched data points, which avoids poor matches based on few points.
  • A minor revision of BistroMath's core function that evaluates the field borders of a profile. The results of a partial edge detection (see above) are now included in the final analysis results.
  • A small improvement of the BistroMath's core function for final analysis. The maximum of a depth dose curve is now fitted with a quadratic fit to evaluate the position and height of the maximum. This might lead to subtle differences with previous versions when the maximum is used for normalisation.
  • In early versions of BistroMath the original 3D coordinates of each data point were not stored in memory. On export the shift was applied to the reconstructed 3D coordinates. For these historical reasons the original 3D position data were not updated in previous versions when a shift was applied. This results in a wrong curve when the stored data of a merge (see below) were read as reference. Now all shift related data are updated. The Match function will become somewhat slower because it uses the Shift function frequently. For succesful merging (see below) the 3D-data are needed including any applied shifts. All shift-related code was removed from all export procedures.
  • Introduction of the composite attribute for curves. When set the presented text in the results panel is changed.
  • Alignment improved for partial curves: only the valid edges are used.
  • The division of two curves is done with filtered versions of these curves. The profiles were aligned again after this filtering including a possibly needed match which is time consuming. Now an already matched profile is not matched again.
  • All revisions above have been tested carefully and can handle all previously known non-standard situations as well as FFF beams with one missing penumbra. One original file of the .opab type with wedge profiles (toe at the target side, in IEC-601 conventions collimator=0°) was converted to the rfb format within OmniPro. This file was opened in BistroMath and showed the correct wedge orientation. This profile was exported from BistroMath as OmnPro-6-format, PTW .mcc, RFA-300 .asc, wms ascii .wtx and wms binary .wda. Al those files were loaded in BistroMath again succesfully with a correct axis representation.
  • As a result of all these revisions, for a FFF beam with one missing penumbra, the available field border will now be given. The field center and field width will still be unavailable.
  • Introduction of the Mayneord transform for photon depth dose curves. The Mayneord transform can be applied from the Processing menu. Use it with caution!
  • Introduction of the Merge function in the Processing menu. All backgrounds can be found in the Merging of scans topic.
  • The Merge function produces a composite curve which can be set as reference. The Merge function also works for partial depth dose curves measured at different SSD's. Dependent on the quality of the accompanying information with the PDD, extra settings may be needed.
  • The settings for Background subtraction, Resample grid, Pips pixel size and Histogram range are moved from the Settings tab to the Advanced Settings tab. In the Settings tab the Merge  and Mayneord settings are added.
  • The raw data of a reference are kept in memory for reuse. A temporary reference is also copied to this area now. In previous versions this was handled by writing a temporary data file. The new setup is much faster and more efficient. This avoids also the chance of any redundant file after exiting BistroMath.
  • Early file type recognition for files read through the clipboard/Editor reduces useless trials for different file types significantly.
  • The lower limit of the left axis in the graphics display is fixed to zero in the unzoomed state with a new option Left Axis lower limit is zero in the View menu.
  • Introduction of Mirrored measurement as Reference in the Processing menu. This is especially practical to evaluate symmetry in non-flat profiles like FFF beams.
  • In the results panel now any resampling is denoted with (r).
  • Smart cycling through multiple scan files. The <Home> jumps to the first valid measurement in the file. When there is more than one scan in a file the scan number is displayed with the bracketed original file format, for example "[omnipro_rfb 1/56]".
  • Introduction of Maximum as Center Position in the Measurement menu.
  • The keyboard shortcuts for the Normalisation sub menu have been changed to a <Ctrl>+<Shift> value.
  • For both matching and merging a faster two point interpolation is done instead of a quadratic fit on at least three points. This has speed advantages and also improves the tracability of results.
  • Support for the Sun Nuclear export file type of the ICprofiler. The device is added to the "multiple scan reference list" at installation.
  • For diagonal scans the start and end point of the scan are now indicated with combinations of T or G  and A or B (e.g. "TA") instead of "L" and "R".
  • The minimum required dose level (as fraction of the maximum) for acceptable normalisation at the origin can now be specified.
  • The logging level can be set in the Advanced Settings tab. More information on finding a reference file is logged when set to 2 or with failed attempts at log level 1.
  • Bugfix in Quadfit fallback mechanism. This was triggered continuously due to change in data underlying types in a library. This could lead to unpredictable results.
  • Bug fix for loading presets: when not in Advanced mode, the preset needed to be loaded twice, to get the User Dose Level accepted. Now Advanced mode is switched on temporarily and restored to the original state afterwards. The default value for the user dose level in the dose calculation engine is set to 50% instead of the (intentional) illegal value of -100%.
  • Minor bug fix: a (in the header reported) zero field size would lead to a needless rejection of the profile.
  • Minor bug fix: The user option to swap axis signs could lead to wrong identification of the "positive" or "negative" diagonal. Any user swapping is now ignored during that evaluation.
  • Minor bug fix: the Move profile to Origin was based on provisional results only. The final center position was only evaluated after the shift and therefore was not exactly in the origin. Now the exact center position is also evaluated before the shift.
  • Bug fix for freescan type. The distance to the starting point was incorrectly defined. Probably never used.
  • Bug fixes for PTW .mcc files.
    Patch for MCC-files: versions with unreliable information on the scan angle ("SCAN_ANGLE=90.00") were found in the wild. A scan angle value of 90 is now ignored.
    Due to an interpretation error the reported "SCAN_OFFAXIS_CROSSPLANE" / "SCAN_OFFAXIS_INPLANE" was mistakenly added to the crossplane / inplane positions instead of the intended offset in the inplane / crossplane position.
    Although the correct information on diagonals is detected this did not lead to the needed change of identity to "diagonal scan".
    The correct identification of "positive" and "negative" diagonal now is made.
  • Bug fixes for exported PTW .mcc files.
    File date/time and measurement date/time were not set correctly in the exported data.
    Also here the same issue on "SCAN_OFFAXIS_CROSSPLANE" / "SCAN_OFFAXIS_INPLANE" was resolved.
    During export the correct curve type information was not preserved and defaulted to "PDD".
    Improved export of diagonals.

    version 2.79 29/07/2015
  • Sorting added to the Files tab. Also some measures were taken to make this feature completely thread-safe.
  • Zooming by creating a rectangle in the graphics screen now handles curves attached to the right axis in the same was as the keyboard/view menu Zoom function does.
  • The size of all texts except the menu is now enlarged automatically within some limits when the window is enlarged. This is only active for the Analysis tab where all text positions are calculated on a form resize. All other tabs have a static design and therefore need a also a fixed font size.
  • With a refinement of the general reading strategy the correct conclusions on the file type are retained when a (possibly multi scan) file does not contain enough data points in a scan. This avoids needless attempts to read with alternative file types. As added bonus, the last displayed status message becomes more meaningful. Now multi scan files which combine real scans with single dose points "scans" can be read succesfully by discarding scans with too few data points automatically. This is the case with PTW mcc files generated by the MultiCheck program of PTW. When generated by BeamAdjust these files start with four legal scans. For this reason an upper limit of 4 scans was hard coded in Bistromath for all Starcheck based mcc-files in previous versions. This limitation is now lifted.
  • In the results panel now any rescaling that changes the SDD is denoted with (z). For PDD's results are denoted with (f) when the fitted data are used.
  • Bugfix: The quadratic filter and median filter did not copy the input to output when no repeated filtering was allowed. This would lead to undefined results. However, effects of this to edge detection related behavior, were never observed in previous versions with the tested data sets. Now it was detected on a PTW scan with varying steps from 1 to 4 mm. When combined with the standard filter range of 6 mm this results in a very limited filtering range.
  • Patch for OmniPro v7 files which use the date format 'MMM-dd-(yy)yy' or 'dd-MMM-(yy)yy'.

    version 2.78 05/06/2015
  • Introduction of an option menu in the Files tab for opening a file or scan and deleting a file. Opening a file was already provided for through double-clicking.
  • Increased file reading speed in the Files tab by applying a separate, interruptable, reading thread.
  • Improved logics for using multiple-scan references. In previous versions the reference menu item Device Specific reference was only enabled when a relevant data set was loaded. When it not was checked, it could only be checked after loading a relevant file, missing the opportunity to handle this file as intended. Now this menu item is always enabled when at least one applicable device is found in the configuration.
  • Although the correct configuration for multiple-scan references is written in institute.ini at install time, this information was lost after rewriting this file. Now, any available setup read at startup, will be written again when a configuration is saved. It is now also described in the 2D arrays topic and the configurations files section.
  • In the results panel now non-standard normalisation is denoted with (n).

    version 2.77 09/05/2015
  • Introduction of Ionisation to Dose conversion for electron depth dose curves. See Measurement menu, scientific backgrounds. This menu item cannot be checked to activate it for all following data like other items in the Measurement menu. Its intended use is application by the user (<Shift-D>) after the date have been read. When the conversion is succesfull the menu item will be checked to reflect the current state. It is always reset for the next curve. The user is responsible for applying this function to the appropriate data. This function can be applied only once on a data set. Returning to the original data is possible by rereading the data (<Ctrl-L>). The old Dose conversion option is now renamed more correctly to OD to Dose conversion.
  • Refinements in user interface of Fit Results tab (adjustment column width, show label in messagebar as response to click-event).

    version 2.76 15/04/2015
  • Minor bugfix in edge detection fallback method with derivatives. As interpolation method the peak in the derivative function is fitted with a second order function. There was no check on fit results outside the fit range with noisy or non-penumbra data points. Now the calculated peak position is guaranteed to be within the range of the used data. When an invalid result is detected the outer points of the data are discarded until a valid result is found.
  • For relative curves, especially depth dose data, the position of the maximum may vary wildly. Therefore the found normalisation position may be pulled away from the preferred position during analysis. Both absolute and relative normalisation position are now afterwards copied from the measurement.

    version 2.75 24/03/2015
  • More flexibility and support for dates with only two digits for the year and the am/pm time format. Both may be system dependent and are critical for detection of the OmniPro v7 format.
  • A patch (with full backward compatibility) for systems with a comma as decimal point separator (which is not preferred anyway). This lead in all previous versions to a wrong interpretation of the modality data in the configuration tab. As consequence the calculated division of measurement and reference could be normalised to a wrong level. On rewriting any configuration file these data will be separated with a " | ". Note that mixed usage of a network installation is problematic for old configuration files, these should be rewritten.
  • Minor bugfix: the resampling grid size was stored in the configuration by both form and calcuation engine under different names, leading to a zero value at start.
  • Minor bugfix: when no modality data were available, the [WellhoferObject] section was not written to a configuration file as this was considered to be an invalid situation in the past. Now these data are stored. No complaints on this were ever reported. Writing a configuration file is displayed on the statusbar.
  • Added a Redefine Temporary reference to the Processing menu.
  • Label "Profile step" in Advanced Settings tab changed to "Shift step". The lower boundary is set at 0.01 cm.
  • Automatic unzoom for pdd's made optional in View menu.
  • A line with meaningful data is added to the Configuration Tab when no data are found.

    version 2.74 04/02/2015
  • Minor bugfix in the configuration tab: changing the selected row in edit mode would not update the changes correctly.
  • Minor bugfix: show right axis labels always when a pdd-fit is done.
  • Minor update: changing the normalisation now forces immediate analysis without need to reload the data.
  • Minor update: In the Files tab the selection filter is explicitely set to  "*.*".
  • Minor update: In the Fit Results tab a separate checkbox for header information is introduced. The labels checkbox does not include the labels anymore. Preferences for both checkboxes are now written to any config or preset file. 
  • Compiler fix pack included.

    version 2.73 21/11/2014
  • A minor bugfix in the rather obscure hdf-format: positive values of the trackstart value were set to zero, leading to a shift of all voxels. Negative values were handled correctly. As this format was only used for film data, all positions were relative anyway. To demonstrate the interpretation (see description of format) in the selftest file selftest05_hdf.txt, the center of all voxels is shifted 0.01 cm to the left and, to compnsate this, the track start and stop are shifted 0.01 cm to the right. Therefore the center of all voxels in track coordinates is unchanged.
  • Minor bugfix: the ignore fie type checking for temporary files functionality was lost in version 2.71. Reviewed and tested.
  • Minor bugfix: for depth doses calculated curves presenting a division the configuration "normalise at dose max" the maximum of the relative curve was used. Of course the maximum of depth dose data itself should be used here. This lead to an inconsistent graphical representation without further consequences.
  • When the file type checking against the temporary reference fails, a message is put in the statusbar.
  • When the calculated curve is a gamma analysis, this is explicitely displayed as axis title on the right axis.
  • When used, the right axis scale is colored to emphasise its relation with its related curve. In most cases this will be the calculated curve. The activation of the right axis now responds much more natuaral to the Zoom function.
  • A selftest for gamma analysis for a FFF beam is added.

    version 2.72 24/10/2014
  • Rescaling of a measurement at some SSD to default SSD.
  • Comparison of rescaled measurements with references at default SSD. Only a geometrical scaling is applied.
  • Inclusion of SSD in axis title options.
  • Selftest for SSD rescaling.
  • Validation of the PTW format for phantom rotation. No problems found.

    version 2.71 10/10/2014
    Due to lack of user response the only base for changes is the local needs.
  • Inclusion of the SSD into the file name of reference files. This is fully backwards compatible with previous versions, old files will be renamed according to the contents of the file after being opened. However, the implication is that the SSD will be part of the equivalence criteria. Therefore the default SSD is introduced in the Settings tab.
  • Introduction of measurement value points curve. The Points display size can be set.
  • A start has been made with the documentation of the config files.

    version 2.70 30/09/2014
  • Small refinements in logics of user interface.
  • Support for OmniPro v7 ascii files without reference signal.

    Due to topic size limitations the older history is moved to History v2.00 - v2.69.

    See also:
     Configuration
     Recent History
     History v1.00 - v1.99
     History v2.00 - v2.69



    History v3.00 - v3.25
    general information 

    version 3.25, 23/11/2018
    build 641
  • X/Y/Z/dose data lines without any known header are not yet supported but did introduce problems. For now these data sets are safely ignored. Implementation is put on the wish list.
  • A new Generic to Electron item is introduced in the measurment menu.
  • The ill-chosen name "linearity" as alternative measure for symmetry is now replaced with "elevation". No further substantial changes.
  • Bug repair: in (initialisation part of) match procedure could in seldom cases go in to endless loop.
  • Introduction of Smart scale electron PDD option in View menu.

    version 3.24, 30/09/2018
    build 633
  • A bug was found in the Gamma Analysis which could lead to out of data range operations.
  • When the position of reference profile is matched to the measured profile the normalisation position and its strategy on whicht is is derived are taken from measured profile.

    version 3.23, 27/09/2018
    build 632
  • A measurement renormalisation mode is introduced.
  • Bugfix: In the histogram for a Gamma Analysis were also invalid points (with a value of zero) included. This influenced the confidence limit, based on the histogram. Also, now both the histogram based value and the "raw data" value are shown. The limitation to the In-Field area is clarified in the help item.
  • The default display rule for the confidence limit is now expanded to alle scan types.
  • The file save dialog path was unintentionally reset to the startup directory. Now it keeps the chosen path.

    version 3.22, 14/09/2018
    build 620
  • Bugfix: Edge detection fallback failed to trigger during analysis because underlying data were made invalid during filtering in derivative calculation. The underlying code was introduced in version 3.21. This filter behavior is switched off now for the derivative calculation.
  • Bugfix: The interpretation of the scanangle is changed: the diagonal TAGB is swapped with TBGA. Also this bug was introduced during code revisions in version 3.21.
    build 628, 11/10/2018
  • Show units of horizontal axis (cm or mm).
  • Bugfix: Sometimes analysis failed due to out of boundary error in left-over non-functional code. Code removed.
  • Number of decimals (in default setup) for PDD20/10 reduced from 4 to 3.
  • Assumptions of being a depth dose or a profile for poorly defined data are now explicitely stated in the messages tab.
  • The speed of the sigmoid fit was severely limited by the reporting on the messagebar. Now the reporting is limited to loglevel 2 and higher for the measurement data only.
  • Minor display bug: the error points for a pdd fit were always displayed on a cm scale.
  • "Add" mode introduced in the Panel setup. Also, introducing a rule with a negative ID will remove any rule with that number.
  • Minor bugfix: Ability for comparison of unrelated profiles was lost.

    version 3.21, 03/06/2018
    build 611
  • To avoid confusion for a pdd with a non-maximum normalisation also the values at the cursor position are annotated.
  • New feature: the possibility to assign the origin value from the StarCheck 2D-array GT line to the other lines as extra point.
  • Limit to In-Field area option made available for Gamma Analysis.
  • Minor bug: merge settings were hidden behind other groupbox in Settings tab.
    build 611, 11/06/2018
  • New option to normalise the source data in the Signal correction sub menu.
  • Bug found in presented values after shift in a depth dose. Related to not updated version of filtered version of the measurement.
  • Display error: "RDD" and "PDD" were swapped.
    build 616, 23/07/2018
  • The alias list is now also applied to the measurement device name. This opens new possibilities for multiple devices with a shared reference but different name. This is the case the StarcheckMaxi.
    build 617, 21/08/2018
  • Bug found in scan angle definition for some diagonal scans due to wrong ordering of instructions in code in version 3.09 after an attempt to cover also 90 degrees scan angles. In these cases the scan angle was set to 90 degrees for these scans. This should be 45 or 135 degrees for true diagonal scans. Also, BistroMath now relies on its own calculation of the scanangle and overrides any scan angle information in a data file. Due to this switch in strategy there might be a mixup in the reference files: possibly files with '045' have to be renamed to 135 and vice versa.

    version 3.20, 01/02/2018
    build 600
  • Version 3.20 offers a fully configurable Results panel with panel rules. The old rather complicated display procedure for showing the panel results under all circumstances is now replaced by a large set of tests that is applied to every item on the Results panel rule list. All configuration issues are presented in a setup page. The standard setup resembles previous versions. This should accommodate for most wishes at local sites. There is a speed penalty when a division is calculated. This is now done separately for the results panel and for the graphical presentation. This takes some 65 ms extra.
  • The Results panel height is now adjusted automatically with a minimum of 5 lines and a maximum 13 lines.
  • All lengths and positions can be displayed in mm.
  • Improved failure reporting when loading reference files for 2D arrays.
  • Some subtle inconsistencies were found with the normalisation in the analysis engine and the transfer to the Results panel display procedure. This might give small differences with previous versions.
  • A new annotation:  (*) for applied normalisation data from the configuration data.
  • A preview of the keyboard buffer to avoid needless updates of the user interface.
  • FFF detection explicitely limited to photon data.
  • The measurement menu has been slightly reorganised. Less used items are moved to submenu's.
  • Introduction of Clear Merge source item in the Processing menu.
  • Minor bug fix: after using Merge an internal activity counter was not decreased, effectively disabling the acceptance of new data. Now a message is shown in such cases ('Analysis object reports busy state.').
  • Bug fix in shift procedure: When a profile is shifted (horizontally) and the normalisation position is set the the origin, the normalisation position should be kept at the origin and the normalisation value should be recalculated. This had only an effect on the Gamma calculation where dose differences are relevant. In all other there has been no effect at all of this bug.
    build 601, 10/02/2018
  • For mcc files crossline offset was linked to inline positions and vice versa in june 2016. This swap is reversed now.
  • Added a "trim" instruction when reading lines of a mcc file to remove illegal spaces in the data of home-made files.
    build 602, 14/02/2018
  • Minor display only bug fix: In the results panel lables that indicated a negative position (i.e. "X-12.0") were displayed with two negative signs: "X--12.0".
    build 603, 19/02/2018
  • The displayed text in the messages tab for electron pdd fits was different from the actually used model. It should be "pdd = I0/( 1 + I1*Exp((-mu1+(mu2+(mu3+mu4*(cm-d0))*(cm-d0))*(cm-d0))*(cm-d0)) + Ib*Exp(-mub*cm) ) + Ix*exp((-mx1+mx2*cm/100)*cm/100)".
    build 604, 22/02/2018
    In the Varian w2CAD format no field is defined for the Linac name. BistroMath therefore takes the comment field in a desparate attempt to get anything at all. In files generated by Eclipse the comment "(Open)" was found. Because of the brackets the complete string was discarded as Linac name. With no linac name at all comparison would fail with this file set as temporary reference (and Ignore Treatment Unit name checked). Only unchecking Check Temporary Scan Type would allow a comparison. Now only assumed illegal characters are stripped from the Linac name, in the example above leading to "Open". With this name the comparison is working again.
    build 605, 26/02/2018
    As correction on built 604 still the Linac name is clipped at the first space to be consistent with previous BistroMath versions. 
    build 606, 16/03/2018
  • When clicking on a Fit results table column, Bistromath returns to the primary Analysis tab.
  • Improved file reading for rfb files. Finally the bytes representing the number of files in a subgroup were identified. Previous versions of BistroMath mysteriously failed to find all scans in some of these files.
    build 607, 20/03/2018
  • Clarification for symmetry of FFF profiles: not the classic NCS symmetry definition but the Elevation (former: Linearity) is displayed in the standard rule set. In previous builds of version 3.20 this was hard coded. Now it is implemented as a rule in the standard rule set.
    build 608, 30/03/2018
  • In the division of two curves clipped data could lead to an invalid result and the whole curve would be discarded. Now the data range is limited to unclipped data only. 
    build 609, 03/04/2018
  • Diagonal detection is limited to fields larger than 2 cm as smaller fields widen because of penumbra effects. 
    build 610, 12/04/2018
  • Patch on build 600: the depth of a PDD-level xx, Dxx, was only available for predefined values (90%, 80%, 50% and 20%). Now a panel rule can be made for any level.

    version 3.10, 28/11/2017
    build 584
  • Introduction of the Area ratio as alternative measure for the symmetry.
  • SpecialMode2 support for area ratio.
  • Minor bug: SpecialMode2 might have been defunctional since version 3.00. No complaints received however.
    build 585, 05/12/2017
    In the advanced settings tab the application of edge detection can now be forced, the application of the sigmoid model can be set separately for conventional and FFF profiles.
    build 587, 06/12/2017
    The background subtraction worked on both measurement and reference. This is not logical. Therefore in the reference menu a Background correction switch is introduced. It is off by default.
    build 589, 15/12/2017
  • Linearity added to SpecialMode2.
  • Files with multiple scans may be looped automatically after opening by using <Ctrl-PageDown>.
  • Either Linac Error, Area Ratio or Linearity can be desplayed as an extended symmetry parameter.
    build 593, 27/12/2017
  • Curve selector added and execution efficiency improved for SpecialMode2.
  • General execution efficiency improved by keeping more data in memory.
    build 595, 15/01/2018
  • Minor bug: Values at User dose level were not generated.
  • Minor bug: Effects of symmetry correction invisible on screen.
  • Gamma analysis limited to In-Field area. In coming version 3.20 both options will be available.


    version 3.09, 08/11/2017
    build 581
    Depending on the source format the diagonal scans could be presented as TA-GB instead of the intended GA-TB direction. In tracing back the origin of this phenomenon no errors were found in the interpretation file formats except for diagonals in the PTW StarCheck mcc format. In the central data preparation procedure the scan angle definition was erroneous due to the user mapping constraints. Note that the scan angle is always derived from the GTABUD axis conventions.
    For the StarCheck all data have been checked from and to the mcc format with absorbers put on selected positions.


    version 3.08, 30/07/2017
    build 574
  • The Mayneord transform was limited to SSD's larger then 50 cm in the code, making it non-functional for some orthovolt data. This limit is now set to 5 cm. When the Dmax for this transform was set negative or zero the actual Dmax of the measurement was taken. However, for orthovolt data a value of zero is meaningful here. Therefore now only a negative Dmax will be set to the actual Dmax.
  • The Mayneord item is moved from the Processing menu to the Measurement menu. As processing item it could be applied multiple times to one data set. In the new setup it can be included in the main analysis stream.
  • The Mayneord transform can now only be applied once to a measurement. Its application is now stored with the curve data as a separate flag.
  • The power function in the photon fit model is problematic for negative z values. In this case the power function is now replaced with the z value itself (effective setting the power value to 1).
  • The Mayneord transform state is now explicitely shown instead of the more generic "composite" state for the measurement in the Results panel.
  • The high order nature of the photon model leads to "resonances" of the model around the measured curve. Therefore the "error to noise ratio" (ENR) was introduced in version 2.86. For the orthovolt energies this leaves not enough weight to model the start of the curve. This can be overcome by switching off the ENR or giving the low z range a higher weight. The latter is now introduced. The user should experiment with optimal settings here.
  • A parameter limiting mechanism is added to the Nelder-Mead code. Now the parameter I1 is limited to a positive range.
  • The Nelder-Mead optimisation code was reviewed in a twofold manner. With some small reorganisations the code is made much faster without any functional changes. Afterwards this loop has been made thread-save and can now be started mutiple times in parallel on different cores. When all threads have completed, the best result is selected and redistributed on a possible restart of all threads. Therefore an evolution characteristic is now added to the original concept which improves the effectiveness significantly.
  • There is now an overview of all relevant parameters for the fit of PDD curves. The Settings tab and Advanced settings tab have been sligthly reorganised to accommodate the overview.
  • When there is still some analysis active, no new data are accepted to avoid multithreading conflicts.
  • Minor bug detected: with a multiple scan reference (i.e. a 2D array) the internal buffers were only partly cleared when the Settings tab was opened. On return to analys this made the reference effectively non-functional. This state could only be resolved by loading a scan with a single scan reference. Now these buffers are completely cleared, forcing the reload of a multiple scan reference.
    build 575, 04/08/2017
  • While testing the pdd fit on more data and different circumstances, it was observed that the initial data could produce an illegal starting point for the optimalisation. Now the initial data have been slightly changed. Also the assignment of the initial data is placed in a loop where, if needed, the initial values are changed with an increasing random fraction several times to find a legal starting point.
    build 576, 09/08/2017
  • The Mayneord transformation is now only applied if meaningful (the new SSD differs from the original) and when applied the reference pdd is reloaded again from either a now matching source or the temporary set reference.
    build 577, 12/09/2017
  • Stability precautions in the presentation layer by using the buffer only with valid (fit) data.
    build 578, 14/09/2017
  • In the Configuration tab the modality format (e.g. 'X10.0') is now set to two decimals to accommodate low energy x-rays like 'X0.05'. Note that all data found in a configuration file are now always forced to this new format.
    build 579, 28/09/2017
  • In the Files tab the data grid is made gray during file search and sorting as "busy" signal. Because the search process is handled in a separate thread the moment of finishing is unclear for the user otherwise. When finished it is set to the standard color again.
  • Minor bug fix: for diagonal scans the linac name and ennergy were lost in the reference file name; therefore references could not be found.
  • In the LoadReference routine a message is added that shows the standard name as derived from the measurment.


    version 3.07, 26/06/2017
    build 570
  • The pdd-fit is adapted for low and medium photon beams. The model itself is not changed but now the data up to the water surface are included when the found position of the dose maximum is smaller than 3 mm or available data stop withn 3 mm of the dose maximum. There were some stablity issues with the standard photon model for the low energy photon beams. Extra precautions have been taken to keep the model parameters within reasonable limits. Both the Reprocessing option (<Ctrl-P>) and Reset fit option (<Ctrl-Z>) can be used repeatedly to find better fits. Due to both the nature of the Nelder-Mead fit optimisation and the type of model, extreme values can occur. The Nelder-Mead code has been reviewed to handle multiple illegal error function outcomes in a better way.
  • Both the maximum of the Top model or the intersection of  the slopes (Slopes model) can be used to define the center of the field. Now this result can also be used as alignment criterium without choosing this as center definition.
  • At startup already available data on the clipboard are ignored.


    version 3.06, 25/05/2017
    build 567
  • Severe bug fix: Due to a procedure call with wrong default assumptions the results of the sigmoid calculation were (partially) plotted outside of the assigned memory borders. This may give unpredictable random errors. All users are therefore advised to update to this version. No more memory conflicts have been detected.
  • Major bug fix: the configuration tables in the Configuration Tab were messed up when edited. Effectively only direct editing of the configuration file  would set the correct information.
  • Major bug fix: editing the configuration tables in the Configuration Tab was nearly impossible as most non-numeric key input was intercepted by the menu system. Now this is disabled.
  • Bug fix: the activation of Generic Beam lists was not transferred from the user interface to the beam evaluation unit effectively making this feature only available if set in the configuration file. It now works as intended.
    build 568, 06/06/2017
  • Due to a mixup in build 567 the keyboard-only shortcuts were made available exlusively for the Configuration tab instead of all other tabs.
  • Bug fix: the mirror-function was reviewed for its effect with different profiles and centering options. It was concluded that the current practice, mirroring around the Center of Field (CoF) will suit for all scenarios. However the implementation effectively mirrored around half of the CoF value. This is corrected.
    build 569, 08/06/2017
  • For 2D-datasets the dataset was kept as reference after the mirror-function was stopped. Now all reference-buffers are fully cleared on unsetting this mode.
  • The SHA-256 checksum of BistroMath is now put in the Messages tab. This can be checked online, see for instance https://defuse.ca/checksums.htm#checksums.


    version 3.05, 13/04/2017
    build 564
  • Review of centering and normalisation choices in the Measurement menu: for FFF there can now be made a completely independent choice.
  • A more general approach for applying offsets in any direction to any profile is now offfered in the Settinsg tab. This can be practical for devices like 2D-arrays, which cannot set the origin easily. Note that these values are introduced in the preprocessing stage immediately after the axis mapping. The old PDD shift was set as a postprocessing shift.
  • FFF detection is limited to scans crossing the isocenter or pararallel to the main axes: the AB, GT and Angle type. A diagonal scan with a shifted measuring device will become a "free scan" when the origin is not crossed within 0.5 cm.
  • For SNC ICprofiler clipboard data additional frame data after the array data will be ignored. Multtiframe data (*.prm files) are not yet supported. This will be availabe in the near future.
    build 565
  • Bugfix: The appropriate choice for centering a FFF field was after application overwritten with the choice for a conventional field. All subsequent results were set with the "conventional" choice.
  • Minor bugfix: the FFF Center submenu in the Measurement menu would toggle the checked status each time the submenu was entered. This status is never used in the code but confusing for the user.
    build 566, 05/05/2017
  • Minor bugfix: in extreme examples found for the ICPROFILER the sigmoid calculation would fail. The validity of the result was not checked however in the results presentation, leading to a program error. This is now handled.


    version 3.04, 19/01/2017
    build 551
  • Several problems with failing sigmoid fits were found and resolved. One single unacceptable data point (position=0) would invalidate the whole fit. Also the acceptable average fit error was set to an absolute value, which would fail for data sets with very high values. Now this limit is made relative.
  • When the sigmoid model is used, the result for the unfileterd measurement are presented, because the model itself uses already a lot of points.
  • On initial preparation of read data the values ara rescaled when the maximum is larger than 1000 or smaller than 0.1.
  • The relative error is only displayed when then Calculated curve is also visible.
  • Merged pdd's ended up in the wrong (invisible) destination when they had different ssd's and were loaded in the "wrong" order. Now this ordering sensitivity is resolved.
  • For curves with multiple peaks (stripe like field setup) for levels above 65% the wrong position was found without local peak analysis.
  • FFF detection failed for the very steep penumbra's of the MRLinac.
  • The mirroring is now done around the chosen/calculated center of field.
  • The profile matching is improved to be stable for profiles without penumbra. A new inclusion criterium was introduced here.
  • Several minor issues were resolved.
    build 552, 24/01/2017
  • On export of MCC inplane profiles now always the TARGET_GUN direction is enforced. In previous versions the internal default GUN_TARGET was used, resulting in both axis direction reversal and sign inversion for the scan positions. Although correct, this deviates from the PTW standard.
  • A remaining issue with scan axis offset for MCC-export was resolved.
  • Resolved an issue with superfluous lines from the original file on overwriting an existing file.
    build 554, 05/02/2017
  • For FFF profiles the general choice for center of field to origin was ignored. Effectively the edge based center was set and (correctly) as such reported.
  • The option Detect FFF in the Measurement menu was not stored in any configuration or preset. This is now written as a preset (and therefore also in a configuration).
  • Also the optional choice to use the top of the FFF profile was ignored when the general choice for the center was set to origin. 
  • All items related to edge detection and sigmoid analysis are now part of a preset.
  • Unnessesary use of the sigmoid fit is avoided.
  • A textual clarification in the results panel: for FFF profiles there is, in general, not a meaningful 80-20 penumbra distance. As alternative the normalised slope of the sigmoid fit is presented.
    build 555, 09/02/2017
    Serious issues with matching introduced in build 551 were found. The problems originated from attempts to limit the search range for matching because a wide search range could lead to improper results. Now another strategy is followed.
  • When a profile was matched with itself the program would go into an infinite loop. This situation would occur when a temporary profile was loaded and matching was chosen as alignment method.
  • For FFF fields with missing penumbras the attempted strategy led to a far too large initial shift with improper results. Merging of such profiles with profile matching as merge parameter  would lead to garbish. 
    build 556, 12/02/2017
    Reviewed missing penumbra strategy for analysis of FFF profiles. In these cases the missing penubra is ignored. The derivative edge is set to the scan limit when this represents the highest found penumbra gradient. In this case the found edge position is assumed valid. The FFF slopes are always guaranteed to be centered around the top. 
    build 557, 15/02/2017
    Minor bugfix: when first a multiscan file from a 2D array was read including the according reference, then a watertank scan for the same machine would find the reference acceptable.
    build 558, 20/02/2017
    Bugfix: An extra test in the analysis introduced a division by zero error for pdd's.
    build 560, 21/03/2017
    Further input checking and range checking added. No functional changes.
    build 561, 27/03/2017
    Minor bugfix: for the status of the FFF center the checked and unchecked state in the user interface were mixed up. All analysis and reporting in the Results panel were consistent with the transferred information to the analysis module but not with the expectancies of the user.


    version 3.03, 08/12/2016
    build 534
  • Recently a British report was published on FFF beams. They propose a virtual profile, made as the division of small(er) profile with a large profile, as means of analysis. The resultant virtual profile resembles pretty close a conventional profile. This is implemented here as a synthetic profile.
  • To make this work an ignorance mechanism was introduced to handle differences in parameters that usually should be equal for a comparison.
  • The coded names of the items in reference menu are changed. Please use the update option of the install program to make the ini files consistent. Note that this feature can be applied to any data directory.
  • A privacy statement has been added to the help file.
    build 535, 18/12/2016
  • The divide function offers a median filter as post-processing. This was and is intended for "shapeless" output. For synthetic (i.e. virtual) profiles. the post-processing is now switched off and a quadratic filter is applied instead.
  • A privacy statement and checksum are added to this help file. The privacy statement is also added to the install file.
    build 536, 20/12/2016
  • Systematic search for leftover possibilities for division by zero in the code.
    build 537, 22/12/2016
  • Minor bug fix: going to the Settings tab or Advanced settings tab would make the in-memory version of an automatically loaded reference invalid but still block reloading it again. No reference was used or displayed until another reference file was taken.
  • Clarification in the help file: the vertical range of the gamma plot is controlled by the Histogram range.  [based on user input, thank you!]
  • The  Histogram range can now also be changed with <arrow-Up>/<arrow-Down> key when a histogram is shown or a gamma plot is shown. [based on user input, thank you!]
  • The histogram horizontal range and gamma plot vertical range increment steps are now controlled explicitely to produce nice steps. Previous versions could produce identical numbers on the scale because of the chosen number of digits in the lables.
    build 538, 27/12/2016
  • After detection of the first FFF profile, only once the help file is opened on the getting started with FFF topic. This action is stored in the used configuration file.
  • At last the context sensitive help for html-help type help files sorted out. Checked all pages for the correct context.
  • A Histogram help topic is added.
  • For reading the files in the Files tab now a separate analysis engine is used, avoiding any interference with possible data in shown in the Analysis tab.
    build 541, 30/12/2016
  • Warning for the first detected FFF profile only if Show warnings is checked.
  • Now the Flatness results are given separately as an Absolute flatness and a Relative flatness.
  • When a gamma calculation is made, the Relative flatness is replaced by the Confidence Limit.


    version 3.02, 21/11/2016
    build 532
  • No functional changes, but the actual applied rules for calculation of center and borders are now consistently stored in history data with the profile. Therefore the reporting is no longer based on the information in the front end. The reporting detail is expanded.
  • When comparison to a temporary reference fails, information about conflicts is added to the Messages tab. This may be very interesting for a lot of users.
    build 533, 22/11/2016
  • Conflict reporting is now also added for merging.
  • The Diagonal detected status is added to the conflict reporting.


    version 3.01, 09/11/2016
    build 530, 09/11/2016, alpha release
  • Review of configuration data. Due to historical reasons configuration data for film dose conversion and dept dose normalisation were combined on single lines. These are split in different sections. The configuration tab now presents these data in separate lists. Note that this code change is backward compatible: all found combined data will be split automatically and written in different section when a configuration is saved.
  • A new list of generic beams is introduced. This list links a modality to a linac and is intended cross-referencing with automated reference loading. This behavior can be set in the reference menu. [extension based on user input, thank you!]
  • Complete review of the logistics for film to dose conversion. The relation with the data file type has been removed. Nothing is changed on how these values are applied. The selection of available configuration data is now done in a separate tab.
    build 531, 10/11/2016
  • No changes, out of alpha state


    version 3.00, 13/10/2016
  • This version extends widely the possibilities for multiple references in a single file. Where in previous versions this feature was limited to files with a fixed structure, now any file can be used by creating an index to the file. Note that, by definition, these files cannot be loaded automatically. Also all supported binary files now are accepted as reference file. In previous versions only one singe scan from a binary file was taken. Please read the new overview topic.
  • All data file access was reviewed. Now always the data are placed in a memory stream immediately, which is more efficient for repeatedly opening the same data. In the alpha release one bug appeared here: when changing to another multi-reference file the stream was appended to the existing stream in stead of replaced.
  • Now any supported file including binary types can be used as reference. This opens the opportunity to open an unstructured rfb or mcc file as reference.
  • The alpha state of this version only is related to data reading and reference selection strategy. When new bugs are introduced they are only related to failed reading of data or not using the correct reference in exotic circumstances. The analysis as such has not been changed.
    build 517, 22/08/2016
  • PTW has updated the application BeamAdjust (we have now version 1.9.2.16). In previous versions the scan depth was set at a fixed value of 0.00 mm. In the new version you can set it to the actual depth. This might make old references invalid as they are still set to a depth of 0. The most sensible solution is to mass edit all reference and/or measurement files. I found fnr.exe (https://findandreplace.codeplex.com). This works straightforward. Search for mcc files (*.mcc) and do a find/replace for "SCAN_DEPTH=0.00" with "SCAN_DEPTH=50.00". There is no need to rename the reference files.
  • When an alias is added any existing index for the reference file will be rebuild.
  • File recognition for binary file types might fail in build 516 due to introduction of streams for thease file types. The file pointer was not set to the start on file load.
    build 519, 23/08/2016
  • Loading a binary file, which is not supported through the clipboard, will lock the clipboard; loading a text-based file will restore the last known state for the clipboard. The user can change the clipboard state at any time.
    build 523, 27/09/2016
  • Standard non-alpha release. One serious flaw was found. There was possible loss of reference files due to the usage of multi-scan references. The origin of this bug was the backward compatibility for the naming convention of reference files. Older files were renamed to the latest convention.
  • A number of tests for various combinations of measurements and refererence is described in the Comparison overview topic.
    build 525, 29/09/2016
  • Repeatedly reloading the same file failed to take the in-memory reference.
    build 526, 07/10/2016
  • Extra safety catches on disk file related operations.
    build 527, 13/10/2016
  • Merging of profiles with different setup parameters (i.e. scan direction, field size, depth, collimator) was and is not allowed. Now there is a message displayed in the status bar in these cases. [improvement based on user input, thank you!]
    build 528, 29/10/2016
  • Tab character added before dose value in data line of exported RFA300 file. [user input, thank you!]


    See also:
     Configuration
     History v1.00 - v1.99
     History v2.00 - v2.69
     History v2.70 - v2.98



    History v3.30 and subversions
    general information 

    version 3.30, 11/12/2018
    build 649
  • New: A fundamental feature of BistroMath, normalising data to (mostly) 100 at some position, can now be switched off completely. Note that for any analysis this factor still is needed and used. Therefore switching Autoscaling off is only meaningful for the comparison of absolute data with a relative scaled data set and may be combined with the measurement renormalisation feature.
  • New: Support for OmniPro v8 (myQA platform).
  • Changed parameters for SpecialMode2.
    build 650, 20/12/2018
  • Minor bug: when a potential multiscan format, like the PTW .mcc, containing just one single scan, is used as reference from file, at reload of the scan this reference would be ignored. Now such a file is not marked as a multi-reference file.
  • Improvement: When in the gamma analysis local dose is used as the base for the dose deviation, this is also displayed in the title on the vertical axis.


    version 3.30.01-20, 01/07/2020
    build 651-684
    Several test builds are being made with simplified and more standard code to improve the portability towards Lazarus. No functional changes should show.
    All these changes are also incorporated in the upcoming version 4.00.
  • New: An extra option is added to the file menu to save also the filtered version of a curve (if available).
  • New: SpecialMode2 now also writes to the clipboard.
  • New: Output of SpecialMode3 resampled data is now optional.
  • New: In the Processing menu an option is added to apply the calculated sigmoid fit to a copy of the measurement in the Buffer curve. This might be convenient to observe the results of the sigmoid fit.
  • New: Beside of Advanced Mode a Simple Mode is introduced to hide a lot of features.
  • New: The clipboard observer now ignores text data which start with "BistroMath" or are less or equal the configurable value MinClipBoardBytes.
  • New: The add-mode for the panel elements configuration can now also be negative to clear all existing rules.
  • New: Clicking on values in the Results panel will copy the result to the clipboard.
  • Major design change: The separate editor window is replaced by a raw data tab.
  • Minor design change: In the reference information line the auto shift value is always displayed with a sign ("+" or "-").
  • Minor design change: When background subtraction is needed, an empty modality type is acceptable.
  • Minor design change: More consistent behavior of the Zoom/Unzoom function.
  • Minor design change: Rereading the configuration is avoided on change of the Advanced Mode status. Instead the OD conversion mode is enabled/disabled accordingly.
  • Minor design change: The graph data for the buffer were not filled when the user set the buffer curve to invisible. Making the buffer visible again would have no effect until new data were read. This proved to be problematic with the port to Lazarus. Now the buffer graph data always contain valid data, even if not used. Also in the graph processing extra checks are inserted to assure valid data. As added bonus the View Buffer item now responds more intuitively.
  • Minor design change: Loading the raw data in a viewer in a tab owned by the main thread through a separate thread shows to be problematic and is abandoned at the cost of some speed loss.
  • Minor design change: The sigmoid fit of the penumbra proved to be faster (and therefore better) when done as a single process in the main thread only instead of multiple competing threads offering comparable results. The latter is now only done for the pdd fit where it offers significant speed to find a good result. [v16]
  • Minor design change: in SpecialMode2 the scan number is added for a multiscan file. [v17]
  • Minor design change: Sigmoid fitting is now limited to 2 times the sigmoid fit radius. [v17]
  • Minor design change: The initial slope of the sigmoid model as calculated from the data should have a minimal value to represent a normal penumbra. [v17]
  • Minor design change: Due to discontinued support for 80 bit floating point values on Windows10/64, in this version a discretisation is built in the way BistroMath decides which points to use for the quadratic filtering and first derivative. Although the calculation differences are far beyond clinical relevance, this effect can change on a random basis which points to include. It will have some influences on field borders, at most 0.03 mm in the supplied test data. This new discretisation will also be used in the upcoming version 4 and therefore will show exactly reproducible result compared with this version. [v17]
  • Minor bug: The key shortcut <Shift>+<0> (for the Preserve original data on export measurement menu item blocked the usage of ")" for changing the size of the value points of the measurement curve. The new shortcut is <Shift>+<->.
  • Minor bug: With the Values off BistroMath responded on the  <left> and <right> keys with a tab change instead of a cursor change.
  • Minor bug: Out of boundary access of data in Derive filter. Did never show up in execution.
  • Minor bug: Autoshift in SpecialMode3 messed up alignment. Now fixed.
  • Minor bug: SpecialMode2 was not working when configured with a curve curve selector due to a different order in the code.
  • Minor bug: Opening a binary data file activated the Ignore Clipboard Item in the File menu.
  • Minor bug: When subtracting background, the filtered curve was not updated.
  • Minor bug: In some workflows it was possible to start the display of results without a valid filtered version of the measurement data, which is used as base for a lot of result values. Now this is checked an recalculated when needed.
  • Minor bug: Integer overflow error when writing wms data from non-wms origin. [v17]
  • Minor bug: When Sigmoid analysis was not forced in the settings, invalid results were given with SpecialMode2 output. [v17]
  • Minor bug: The sigmoid slope value for the left slope had the wrong sign, leading to poor start and possibly fit faillure. Also a better esitmate is chosen now. [v17]
  • Minor bug: The sigmoid analysis radius was actually never used but its default value of 10 mm. [v17]
  • Minor bug: In subversion 16 an error was introduced by checking on text contents of the clipboard when it had no text format. This lead clipboard error messages. [v18]
  • Minor bug revealed design flaws, introduced by SpecialMode2. When key 'H' was pressed and SpecialMode2 was used and the border position at user's level was asked for in this mode and the user's level was not equal to 50%, the standard 50% level would change because it now showed the user's level result without further notice. This was not foreseen in the evaluation engine and the results panel processing. [v19]
  • Minor bug: In december 2019 the sigmoid slope was added to the result panel rules. In the actual code this would also use the unfiltered data as source for the 80-20 penumbra width. It was always intended to use (for the better or worse) the filtered version of the data. The effect is subtle. This is repaired now to make it compatible with the soon upcoming major release in Lazarus/Freepascal. [v20]
  • {26/05/2020 apply variable wInflectionSigmoidRadiusCm instead of fixed constant twcDefSigmoidRadiusCm}
  • Bug repair: While porting the analysis engine in earlier subversions of 330.x an error was introduced in a statistics library, ultimately discarding the results of the derivative function. This also blocked the sigmoid function and messed up the right border of the In-Field area.
  • Bug repair: Disabling panels (grouped items) on a disabled tab, because they looked enabled, made labels permanently invisible. Now only the color is set to gray. [v15]
